Themes

These are the themes that run through Al-Anon recovery — the subjects we actually talk about after the meeting. Each theme includes reflections and curated readings to deepen your understanding.

  • Detachment with Love Separating yourself from the chaos without cutting off the caring.
  • Powerlessness & Surrender Accepting what we cannot control and letting go of the rest.
  • Focus on Yourself Shifting attention from the alcoholic back to your own life.
  • One Day at a Time Releasing anxiety about the future and regret about the past.
  • Boundaries Learning to say no as an act of self-respect, not selfishness.
  • Letting Go of Control Recognizing the many ways we try to manage, fix, or manipulate outcomes.
  • Self-Worth & Identity Reclaiming the sense of self that years of crisis eroded.
  • Trusting a Higher Power Finding a source of guidance beyond your own willpower.
  • Honesty & Self-Awareness Getting truthful about your own patterns, motives, and feelings.
  • Gratitude & Hope Moving from despair toward appreciation for progress, even when circumstances haven’t changed.
  • Understanding the Disease Seeing alcoholism as an illness, not a moral failing.
  • Community & Fellowship Breaking isolation and discovering you are not alone.
